Cronmaster is a TypeScript-based web UI for managing cron jobs. It offers a user-friendly interface for creating, viewing, and deleting cron jobs and associated bash scripts, with features like live logging, log history, and system information display.

Drip is a self-hosted tunneling solution written in Go that allows users to securely expose local services to the internet without relying on third-party servers. It offers unlimited bandwidth and requests, enabling users to use their own domains for custom subdomains.

This repository provides a streamlined script to install and run macOS virtual machines on Proxmox VE, supporting a wide range of macOS and Proxmox versions on both AMD and Intel hardware. It simplifies the complex process of Hackintoshing within a virtualization environment.

Dropp is a cross-platform application that provides a persistent dropzone on macOS, allowing users to drag files and sync them to the cloud. These files can then be accessed on other devices, such as Android phones, creating a seamless file transfer and accessibility experience across multiple platforms.
